PARAGRAPH.STRING: (Kazakh: Астана; former names include Aqmola and Tselinograd), estimated population of 600,000 (2004), is the second largest city and the capital of Kazakhstan since 1997. The name "Astana", which in Kazakh language means "Capital city", was allegedly chosen because it is easily pronounced in many languages. However, in Kazakh, it is pronounced "As-ta-na", while in English and many other international languages, the common pronunciation is "As-ta-na".
is within Aqmola Province, though politically separate from the rest of the province, which has its own capital.
is Askar Mamin, formerly Minister for Transportation. He was appointed mayor on 25 September 2006.
